edu.kit.cm.kitcampusguide.standardtypes
Class Map

java.lang.Object
  edu.kit.cm.kitcampusguide.standardtypes.Map
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Map
extends Object
implements Serializable

Represents a map. A map will be used for all floors in each building and the campus map. Each map will be represented by exactly one map-object. Therefore, maps should be constructed either from a consistent source or all at once. If using a consistent source, the map ids can be used to identify the map over the start and end of the program itself. Each map will be saved in the collection of maps once the constructor is used successfully. Stores a unique id, a name, the path to the tiles, a bounding box and the minimal and maximal zoom level. The id is used to identify a map by using getMapByID. The path is used to identify the path of the map tiles used by open layers to render the map. The bounding box is used to mark an box, over which the map can't be dragged. The minZoom and maxZoom is used to define a border for the zoom.

Author:
fred
See Also:

Constructor Detail

Map

public Map(int id,
           String name,
           MapSection boundingBox,
           String tilesURL,
           int minZoom,
           int maxZoom)
    throws NullPointerException,
           IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new map. Once this constructor has been successfully called, the map is added to the list of all maps and can later be retrieved by getMapByID.

Parameters:
id - ID of the new map. Is required to be unique for a correct result.
name - Name of the map. Required not to be null.
boundingBox - The boundaries of this map. Required not to be null.
tilesURL - The path to the files.
minZoom - The minimal zoom level for this map. Required to be >= 0. Required to be <= maxZoom.
maxZoom - The maximal zoom level for this map. Required to be >= 0. Required to be >= minZoom.
Throws:
NullPointerException - If either name, boundingBox or tilesURL is null.
IllegalArgumentException - if minZoom > maxZoom or map with a duplicate id would be created.
Method Detail

getID

public int getID()
Returns the ID of this map. This id is unique. Can be used in combination with getMapByID.

Returns:
the ID of this map.

getName

public String getName()
Returns the name of this map. This name is displayed to the user p.ex. when changing floors.

Returns:
the name of this map.

getBoundingBox

public MapSection getBoundingBox()
Returns the bounding box of the map. This box is used to define how far the map can be dragged.

Returns:
The bounding box of the map.

getTilesURL

public String getTilesURL()
Returns the URL of the tiles. This URL is used to identify the tiles open layers uses to draw the map.

Returns:
The URL of the tiles.

getMinZoom

public int getMinZoom()
Returns the minimal zoom level. This is used by open layers.

Returns:
The minimal zoom level.

getMaxZoom

public int getMaxZoom()
Returns the maximal zoom level. This is used by open layers.

Returns:
The maximal zoom level.

getMapByID

public static Map getMapByID(int id)
Returns the map with the ID id. If there are two maps with this id, only one is returned. However, no guarantee of this is given for future versions. Can be used with getID.

Parameters:
id - The map with this ID will be returned.
Returns:
A map with the ID id or null if no such map exists.

getBuilding

public Building getBuilding()
Returns the building to which this map belongs. If no appropriate building can be found, null is returned.

Returns:
Returns the building to which this map belongs. If no appropriate building can be found, null is returned.
